Possibly so, but there still is a difference between being at war with another country and randomly initiating terrorist bombings.
 
 
To make a distinction between the two, motivation would require a personal gain involvement, such as armed robbery or revenge murder of citizens. 
Or simple hatred.
To state a moral preference for conventional military bombing is not unlike championing skirmish lines dropping to one knee 50 yards apart and firing at each other to see which line breaks first.
I prefer that no wars be fought. However, when a war is being fought, it should be addressed with the most effective means of ending the war. Unfortunately, sometimes that requires tremendous blows to the enemy...such as Nagasaki and Hiroshima.
 The past, conventional and not feasible when one force is no military match for the aggressor.
Again, I differentiate between declared conflict between nations and terrorism. When one nation is no match for another nation, they should give up the war, or never start one.

 If our enemies, with whom we're in a declared war, bombed our president at the Pope's funeral, would you consider them terrorists?
I would consider such an act outside the bounds of conventional rules of war. Number 1, it would likely be outside the battlefields of the declared war, unless we were at war with Italy...in which case I doubt the President would be attending a funeral there (yes, I know the Vatican is really a separate country, but...).
georged

This is now a global society with few realistic boundaries and convention once accepted as fact, like skirmish lines, no longer exists. To demand it is a lesson in frustration, a major cause of failure for our industrial sector and government, especially as a debtor nation. The past is the past. Clinging to past glory limits future opportunity. 
 
 I'd be surprised if an attack was instigated by anyone during the pope's funeral. To do so would be akin to using nuclear weapons, bringing down the wrath of the entire developed world. Besides, our enemies are succeeding in breaking us financially, so why would they expend more resources than necessary?
Taranaki

Can anybody name a terrorist organisation that packed up and went home simply because some of its members were executed for their involvement?
 
 Can anybody name a terrorist organisation that didn't recruit extra members as a result of engaging its enemy?
 
 
 Terrorists are happy to martyr themselves for their cause.A life in jail with hard labour[shovelling pig manure would be good] is a far more effective deterrent.
